intro: Erythrochaete dentata, commonly known as the toothed erythrochaete, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
